intro: Centaurium speciosum, commonly known as the showy centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodlands, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are clustered in dense, branched inflorescences. Centaurium speciosum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
